verblex: 1. To have an experience which is unpleasant, upsetting, or very surprising. English = (be) shocked.
2. To make someone have an experience which is unpleasant, upsetting, or very surprising. English = shock.
partlex: 1. Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action happens so quickly and unexpectedly that you are surprised by it. English = All of a sudden, suddenly.
2. Used immediately next to a verb to mean the action happens earlier than usual. English = prematurely.
nomlex: 1. An experience which is unpleasant, upsetting, or very surprising. English = shock.
